title: 4 capacitors set - C-equivalent of C1 C2 C3 and C4

content.description: A circuit consists of a battery, two resistors, two switches, and four capacitors, as shown in the figure. Each resistor has resistance <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>R</mi></math>, and the capacitors have capacitances <math alttext="C sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="C sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="C sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="C sub 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></math> as indicated. At the time shown in the figure, Switch <math alttext="S sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mtext>S</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> has been closed for a long time and Switch <math alttext="S sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mtext>S</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> is open.
content.question: Which of the following equations could be used to determine the equivalent capacitance <math alttext="C sub equivalent" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>C</mi><mtext>eq</mtext></msub></math> for the combination of four capacitors?

choices.label: <math alttext="C sub equivalent, equals C sub 1, end sub, plus, C sub 2, end sub, plus, the fraction 1 over C sub 3, end fraction, plus, the fraction 1 over C sub 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>C</mi><mtext>eq</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="C sub equivalent, equals C sub 1, end sub, plus C sub 2, end sub, plus, the complex fraction with numerator 1, and denominator open parenthesis, the fraction 1 over C sub 3, end fraction, plus the fraction 1 over C sub 4, end fraction, close parenthesis, end complex fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>C</mi><mtext>eq</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 1 over C sub equivalent, equals the fraction 1 over C sub 1, end fraction, plus the fraction 1 over C sub 2, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator open parenthesis, C sub 3, end sub, plus C sub 4, close parenthesis, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mtext>eq</mtext></msub></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 1 over C sub equivalent, equals the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator open parenthesis, C sub 1, end sub, plus C sub 2, close parenthesis, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator open parenthesis, C sub 3, end sub, plus C sub 4, close parenthesis, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mtext>eq</mtext></msub></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction 1 over C sub equivalent, equals the fraction 1 over C sub 1, end fraction, plus the fraction 1 over C sub 2, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator open parenthesis, C sub 3, end sub, plus C sub 4, close parenthesis, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mtext>eq</mtext></msub></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
